bored.sentence: Bored, she switched from one channel to the next.

excited.sentence: He had been looking forward to the letter and was excited when it  arrived.

ashamed.sentence: The boy felt ashamed when his mother discovered him stealing money from her purse.

sceptical.sentence: Patrick looked sceptical as someone read out his horoscope to him.

satisfied.sentence: Steve felt very satisfied after he had got his new flat just how he wanted it.

aghast.sentence: Jane was aghast when she discovered her house had been burgled.

doubtful.sentence: Mary was doubtful that her son was telling the truth.

playful.description: full of high spirits and fun
playful.sentence: Neil was feeling playful at his birthday party.

thoughtful.sentence: Phil looked thoughtful as he sat waiting for the girlfriend he was about to finish with.

grateful.sentence: Kelly was very grateful for the kindness shown by the stranger.

arrogant.description: conceited, self-important, having a big opinion of oneself
arrogant.sentence: The arrogant man thought he knew more about politics than everyone else in the room.

nervous.sentence: Just before her job interview, Alice felt very nervous.

concerned.sentence: The doctor was concerned when his patient took a turn for the worse.

hopeful.sentence: Larry was hopeful that the post would bring good news.

eager.sentence: On Christmas morning, the children were eager to open their presents.

contemplative.sentence: John was in a contemplative mood on the eve of his 60th birthday.

incredulous.sentence: Simon was incredulous when he heard that he had won the lottery.

friendly.sentence: The friendly girl showed the tourists the way to the town centre.

desire.sentence: Kate had a strong desire for chocolate.

dominant.sentence: The sergeant major looked dominant as he inspected the new recruits.

puzzled.sentence: After doing the crossword for an hour, June was still puzzled by one clue.

sarcastic.sentence: The comedian made a sarcastic comment when someone came into the theatre late.

earnest.sentence: Harry was very earnest about his religious beliefs.

insisting.sentence: After a work outing, Frank was insisting he paid the bill for everyone.

disappointed.sentence: Manchester United fans were disappointed not to win the Championship.

distrustful.sentence: The old woman was distrustful of the stranger at her door.

bewildered.sentence: The child was bewildered when visiting the big city for the first time.

worried.sentence: When her cat went missing, the girl was very worried.

anxious.sentence: The student was feeling anxious before taking her final exams.

fearful.sentence: In the dark streets, the women felt fearful.

intrigued.sentence: A mystery phone call intrigued Zoe.

joking.sentence: Gary was always joking with his friends.

comforting.sentence: The nurse was comforting the wounded soldier.

curious.sentence: Louise was curious about the strange shaped parcel.

irritated.sentence: Frances was irritated by all the junk mail she received.

insulting.sentence: The football crowd was insulting the referee after he gave a penalty.

fascinated.sentence: At the seaside, the children were fascinated by the creatures in the rock pools.

imploring.sentence: Nicola looked imploring as she tried to persuade her dad to lend her the car.

apologetic.sentence: The waiter was very apologetic when he spilt soup all over the customer.

indecisive.description: unsure, hesitant, unable to make your mind up
indecisive.sentence: Tammy was so indecisive that she couldn't even decide what to have for lunch.

assertive.sentence: The assertive woman demanded that the shop give her a refund.

regretful.sentence: Lee was always regretful that he had never travelled when he was younger.

uneasy.sentence: Karen felt slightly uneasy about accepting a lift from the man she had only met that day.

terrified.sentence: The boy was terrified when he thought he saw a ghost.

baffled.sentence: The detectives were completely baffled by the murder case.

cautious.sentence: Sarah was always a bit cautious when talking to someone she did not know.

preoccupied.description: absorbed, engrossed in one's own thoughts
preoccupied.sentence: Worrying about her mother's illness made Debbie preoccupied at work

hostile.sentence: The two neighbours were hostile towards each other because of an argument about loud music.

guilty.description: feeling sorry for doing something wrong
guilty.sentence: Charlie felt guilty about having an affair.

contented.sentence: After a nice walk and a good meal, David felt very contented.

horrified.sentence: The man was horrified to discover that his new wife was already married.

panicked.description: distraught, feeling of terror or anxiety
panicked.sentence: On waking to find the house on fire, the whole family was panicked.

deciding.sentence: The man was deciding whom to vote for in the election.

encouraging.sentence: All the parents were encouraging their children in the school sports day.

embarrassed.sentence: After forgetting a colleague's name, Jenny felt very embarrassed.

stern.sentence: The teacher looked very stern as he told the class off.

sympathetic.sentence: The nurse looked sympathetic as she told the patient the bad news.

threatening.sentence: The large, drunken man was acting in a very threatening way.

confident.sentence: The tennis player was feeling very confident about winning his match.

reflective.sentence: George was in a reflective mood as he thought about what he'd done with his life.

decisive.sentence: Jane looked very decisive as she walked into the polling station.

affectionate.sentence: Most mothers are affectionate to their babies by giving them lots of kisses and cuddles.

dispirited.sentence: Adam was dispirited when he failed his exams.

perplexed.sentence: Frank was perplexed by the disappearance of his garden gnomes.

relieved.sentence: At the restaurant, Ray was relieved to find that he had not forgotten his wallet.

relaxed.sentence: On holiday, Pam felt happy and relaxed.

hateful.sentence: The two sisters were hateful to each other and always fighting.

convinced.sentence: Richard was convinced he had come to the right decision.

depressed.sentence: George was depressed when he didn't receive any birthday cards.

flirtatious.sentence: Connie was accused of being flirtatious when she winked at a stranger at a party.

entertained.description: absorbed and amused or pleased by something
entertained.sentence: I was very entertained by the magician.

offended.sentence: When someone made a joke about her weight, Martha felt very offended.

accusing.sentence: The policeman was accusing the man of stealing a wallet.

suspicious.sentence: After Sam had lost his wallet for the second time at work, he grew suspicious of one of his colleagues.

confused.sentence: Lizzie was so confused by the directions given to her, she got lost.

dubious.sentence: Peter was dubious when offered a surprisingly cheap television in a pub.

reassuring.sentence: Andy tried to look reassuring as he told his wife that her new dress did suit her.

anticipating.sentence: At the start of the football match, the fans were anticipating a quick goal.

indifferent.sentence: Terry was completely indifferent as to whether they went to the cinema or the pub.

resentful.sentence: The businessman felt very resentful towards his younger colleague who had been promoted above him.

pensive.sentence: Susie looked pensive on the way to meeting her boyfriend's parents for the first time.

tentative.sentence: Andrew felt a bit tentative as he went into the room full of strangers.

defiant.description: insolent, bold, dont care what anyone else thinks
defiant.sentence: The animal protester remained defiant even after being sent to prison.

interested.sentence: After seeing Jurassic Park, Hugh grew very interested in dinosaurs.

fantasizing.sentence: Emma was fantasizing about being a film star.

flustered.sentence: Sarah felt a bit flustered when she realised how late she was for the meeting and that she had forgotten an important document.

despondent.sentence: Gary was despondent when he did not get the job he wanted.

jealous.sentence: Tony was jealous of all the taller, better-looking boys in his class.

alarmed.sentence: Claire was alarmed when she thought she was being followed home.

enthusiastic.sentence: Susan felt very enthusiastic about her new fitness plan.

upset.sentence: The man was very upset when his mother died.

amused.sentence: I was amused by a funny joke someone told me.

impatient.description: restless, wanting something to happen soon
impatient.sentence: Jane grew increasingly impatient as she waited for her friend who was already 20 minutes late.

serious.sentence: The bank manager looked serious as he refused Nigel an overdraft.

annoyed.sentence: Jack was annoyed when he found out he had missed the last bus home.
